Title: Weekend Sales Associate, Part-Time
RoleDescription:
Retail Sales & Engagement Associate (Part-Time)
Location: 3232 Lake Ave. STE 1, Wilmette, IL 3232
The pay for this position is $18 per hour.NOTE: We are specifically looking for individuals who have open availability on Friday, Saturday, and Sundays to help meet our customer demand. 
Overview:
As a Retail Sales Associate, you'll play a vital role in creating an inviting and inspiring experience for every Wayfair customer. Youll actively support customers throughout their shopping journey, from answering questions and placing orders to handling returns and solving issues with empathy and precision. Youll thrive in a proactive sales environment, building personalized connections, boosting store performance, and turning first-time shoppers into loyal customers. If you're passionate about delivering top-tier service and love fast-paced, collaborative work, this role offers a great opportunity to grow with a brand redefining the future of home retail.
What Does a Retail Sales Associate Do?

 Engage and Connect with Customers: Build meaningful relationships by asking thoughtful questions to understand each customer's needs and style preferences.
 Demonstrate Reliability: Show up ready to work, on time, every shift. Communicate proactively about any unexpected absences or challenges.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Approach every customer as a new sales opportunity. Educate them on purchase options through POS systems, the Wayfair app, quotes, or online tools.
 Provide Product Expertise: Share tailored recommendations using your knowledge of Wayfairs in-store and endless aisle offerings.
 Support Operational Excellence: Help with carry-outs, curbside pickups, cancellations, cart retrieval, and product returns while keeping the store clean and organized.
 Adapt to a Fast-Paced Environment: Stay agile and energized amid frequent product, promotion, and operational changes.
 Collaborate Effectively: Contribute to store success through replenishment, backfills, floor sets, and sharing fresh ideas.
 Deliver Exceptional Service: Provide personalized support and proactive solutions that make Wayfair a go-to shopping destination.

Youll Thrive in This Role if You Have:

 Selling & Service Experience: 1+ year of experience in retail sales or customer-facing roles. Experience in interior design or specialty sales is a plus.
 Open Availability: Willingness to work nights, weekends, and holidays based on business needs.
 Technical Proficiency: Comfortable using mobile devices, store apps, inventory tools, and POS systems.
 Core Competencies: Strong sales instincts combined with great communication, organization, and relationship-building skills.
 Time Management & Multitasking: Ability to juggle multiple customers or tasks at once while staying focused and accurate.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases.

Title: Visual Merchandising Specialist
RoleDescription:
Full Time Specialist, Visual Merchandising of Wayfair Stores 
Location: 3232 Lake Ave, Wilmette, IL 60091

 Embrace Feedback: Take direction from store leaders and visual managers in stride and translate feedback into polished, brand-right execution.
 Engage Customers: Interact with guests when needed to support a friendly, helpful, and visually inspiring shopping experience that reflects Wayfairs commitment to service.
 Thrive in a Fast-Paced Environment: Work efficiently with changing priorities, new promotions, and evolving product assortments while maintaining strong attention to detail.

 
What are the Job Requirements?

 Visual Merchandising Experience: 13 years of in-store visual merchandising experience required. Background in home furnishings or interior design is a plus.
 Retail Sales Insight: 13 years of experience in retail or customer-facing sales roles, preferably in home goods, dcor, or furnishings.
 Planogram Know-How: Experience reading and executing store layouts or planograms preferred.
 Schedule Flexibility: Ability to work a retail schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays to support business needs.
 Organizational Strength: A multitasking pro with top-notch time management, accuracy, and the ability to prioritize on the fly.
 Tech Confidence: Comfortable using visual merchandising software, devices, and other store tools to support planning and execution.

Title: Senior Designer Consultant - Retail (Full Time)
RoleDescription:
Retail Design Consultant - Houston, TX
Full Time
Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first-of-their-kind luxury retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories.  Come be a part of it!  We are 
hiring experienced Designers who will be responsible for working with both Trade and Consumer clients.  If you are passionate about design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on learning and dynamic challenges, this store might be the future home for your career.
 
What youll do 

Maintain luxury experience standards and provide an authentic, inviting guest experience that exemplifies our commitment to customer satisfaction and passion for luxury design.


Own your book of business end-to-end, fostering long-standing relationships with design clients and prospecting potential new design customers in the store and in the community. 
Meet the complex needs of the Perigold customer, including large-scale luxury projects, trade projects, and intricate custom product development 
Leverage your interior design and sales expertise in the home furnishings space to help our customers navigate through their design needs and purchases.  
Share your expertise in fabric and finishes, bringing awareness to performance, texture and durability characteristics as well as market trends using digital and physical swatches
Manage virtual, in-home, and in-store design appointments (including preparation of design deliverables, product curation, and follow up).
Utilize sales analytics and design software tools and applications to drive store profitability and growth in a way that supports the success of the overall brand (moodboards, space plans, 2d/3d room views).
Efficiently manage your time in design appointments and sales floor interactions by prioritizing the customer experience while keeping communication open with leadership.
Meet or exceed sales and customer satisfaction targets, and other established KPIs. 
Participate in operational store activities as needed:  bringing new products to the floor, floor sets, replenishment and substitutions.
Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations
Engage in a high energy, focused and dynamic work environment where there can be rapid changes in products, promotions, offerings and operations 

 
What youll need
Experience & Qualifications

2+ years of design experience within a design firm or high end furniture retailer.
Professional portfolio required.
Familiarity with Perigold supplier brands, materials and construction, and custom programs a plus.  
Proven track record of managing large-scale projects for luxury B2C and trade customers. 
Passion for design, great customer service and a drive to exceed sales targets.


Strong organization, self-motivation, communication and relationship management skills. 
Technical acumen to learn necessary software; proficiency in Google Suites and/or Microsoft Office applications preferred.
Experience leveraging CRMs/POS/ and design software such as Salesforce, DesignFiles, AutoCAD, Sketchup, Revit, etc. preferred


Demonstrated ability to work within a team sales environment.
Track record of thriving in a fast paced and changing environment.
Bachelors degree or college diploma equivalent specializing in Art, Architecture, or Interior Design preferred. 
Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).

Physical Demands

A valid driver's license is required for in home design visits. 
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

 
Compensation & Benefits

Compensation for this role is a base of $25.50 per hour + substantial quarterly bonuses based on sales achieved and successful prospecting.
Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount.

 
About Perigold
Perigold is the destination for luxury home. Established in 2017, Perigold offers an unmatched selection of the worlds best design brands, with unique pieces for every style and space. The brand offers the highest quality pieces for home, backed by a quality guarantee and expert concierge support. They also offer free white-glove delivery and 30-day returns on most items. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Perigold is part of the Wayfair Inc. (NYSE:W) brand portfolio.

Title: Manager, UK Business Performance & Insight (Finance & Strategy)
RoleDescription:

The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Head of Product, Data & AI
Who You Are: 
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration. 
 
We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.
 
Were looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data & AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.
 
This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross-functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high-performing teams.
 
What Youll Do:

Product Leadership: Develop and drive the overall strategy for our Data & AI Platforms, ensuring alignment with platforms strategy, along with delivering value for your users with in market usable solutions
AI Platforms: Set strategic direction and drive execution for Generative AI capabilities that serve a range of personas, departmental and job function needs, supporting adoption and evangelization across the organization; identify and prioritize high-value use cases, facilitate cross-functional GenAI solutions tailored to diverse personas (developers, scientists, analysts), and guide build-vs-buy decisions to maximize scalability, effectiveness, and organizational impact.
Data Platforms: Oversee the lifecycle of data platform products, including Data Movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, Data production and consumption patterns, quality management, enabling users to self-service these capabilities on our Google Cloud environment
Team Management: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Product Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
Driving adoption and value realization: Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
Communication: Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

7+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data and/or AI platforms
5+ years of product experience in developing data-driven products that are cloud native 
Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real-world problems.
Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced senior software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Predictive Search Service. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
What you will do:

Work with a broader highly collaborative cross-functional team that includes product managers, data scientists, and analysts.
Work with a variety of technologies, including Java, Spark, Kafka, Aerospike, Hadoop, Airflow, RESTful web services, gRPC, Kubernetes. Additionally, youll work with various managed GCP offerings like BigQuery, Composer and Vertex AI.
Build platforms and services that allow us to make realtime ML powered decisions that improve the customers onsite search experience.
Deliver direct measurable results for our business and customers through improved product recommendations.
Mentor junior engineers to develop the next generation of Wayfair engineering.
Provide high quality code and technical design reviews.
Contribute to the code base, with a mind to best practices and an equally high degree of autonomy.

What you will need

A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related engineering discipline.
3-5 years of experience in a modern programming language, preferably Java 
Knowledge of scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of object oriented design and design patterns.
Knowledge of designing APIs and microservices.
Experience working on cloud technologies specifically GCP is a plus.
Experience with Lucene-based Search engines like Elasticsearch is a plus.
Knowledge of recommendation systems and productionalizing ML models is a plus.
Experience using Kubernetes, Docker, Buildkite, and Terraform for containerization and CI/CD is a plus.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.

About the Role:
We're looking for a highly accomplished and independent Corporate Compensation Manager to own and drive our corporate compensation strategy and operations across North America and UK/EU. You'll be instrumental in designing, implementing, and managing compensation programs that are competitive, equitable, and directly aligned with Wayfair's business objectives and talent strategy.

Strategic Compensation Leadership: Drive the end-to-end corporate compensation strategy for North America and UK/EU, ensuring alignment with global compensation philosophy and business priorities.

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
7+ years of progressive experience in compensation, with at least 2-3 years in a dedicated corporate compensation role and clear demonstration of manager-level responsibilities and autonomy.
Deep and comprehensive understanding of compensation principles, practices, and regulations across North America, the UK, and the EU.
Exceptional analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable strategies.
Advanced proficiency in Excel for complex data modeling, analysis, and reporting is essential.
Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to build strong relationships, influence senior leaders, and effectively negotiate.
Proven track record of managing multiple, complex projects independently in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Experience with Workday or other major HRIS systems.

Full-Time Position
Compensation: $16/hour + Monthly Bonus potential

Title: Facilities Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $99,425-$105,425 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
We are Wayfair; we deliver a best-in-class customer experience in the furniture and home space because of people like you, who are driven, determined, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. In order to maintain our high level of delivery standards and meet our customers needs, the Wayfair Distribution team plays a key role in improving customer satisfaction and driving repeat business. Weve been busy building a best-in-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding services, and reducing damage using our own physical, asset-based warehouses. We are looking for talented hard-working individuals to join our growing team  your professional home awaits you at Wayfair in our state of the art Fulfillment Center in Lathrop, CA
What Youll Do

As the Facilities & Maintenance Manager, you will coordinate the maintenance and repair of the entire Distribution Center and all equipment in the building, including conveyors, Material Handling Equipment (MHE), Powered Industrial Trucks (PIT), electrical systems, fire and security systems.
You will act as day-to-day primary authority on repair and maintenance and manage personnel assigned to technical, as well as, maintenance positions.
Youll provide guidance and direction to department managers and maintenance department employees in the areas of customer service, loss prevention, safety, expense control, electronics, mechanical conveyor repair, and lift truck systems.
Youll possess extensive knowledge of the FC layout and flow of product, and be a lead technician skilled in electronics, mechanical conveyor repair and lift truck systems. PLC knowledge is helpful.
You will interface with Management regarding ongoing projects and coordinate maintenance of the facility equipment to meet the needs of the building including coordinating outside contractors that may be required to work in the building.

What Youll Need

5+ years of experience in facilities maintenance management in a distribution center.
Must have experience with Conveyors, MHE, PLC's, Electrical, Plumbing and Fire/Security
Experience with CMMS (Computerized Maintenance Management System) in managing work orders, inventory, and reporting.
Ability to perform physical activity including, but not limited to, sitting, standing, bending, stooping, lifting (up to 50 lbs.), and walking.
Ability to maneuver through storage racks, trailers, and other areas of the warehouse.
Ability to operate equipment found in a distribution center environment including, but not limited to, material handling equipment, and the ability to use office equipment including, but not limited to, phone, keyboard, monitor, and calculator.
Must have effective communication skills both in person and on the computer via other meeting services.
Ability to develop and manage a budget around existing or new facility needs. 
The environmental requirement of the position consists of working indoors in an average office environment 20% of time and in a warehouse environment 80% of time.
Understanding of complex blueprints and construction specifications is a plus.
Exposure with industrial safety including: confined space, electrical, Lock-Out/Tag-Out and other is a plus.

Competitive Salary
Employee discount on our website
Excellent working environment
Company benefits such as Charitable Giving Program, Paid Volunteering Day.

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we are 
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
Wayfair's Search and Recommendations team builds the core platforms and services that allow our customers to discover & buy the products they love. Just last year alone our team has contributed to hundreds of millions in incremental revenue. We do this by leveraging Wayfair's extensive customer and product data to deliver trusted and valuable recommendations in real-time using custom machine learning models. We productionalize these ML models as microservices and build data pipelines necessary for inference and model training.
Our platforms and services are used to power experiences for search, browse across multiple  storefront and marketing channels and are called over a billion times a day. 
We're looking for an experienced software engineer to join our highly impactful team to help us build and extend our Storefront team. A Software Engineer will be responsible for high quality implementation and consistent maintenance of systems that support auto-complete search behavior on Wayfair's sites. We have ambitious goals to improve this search functionality to better understand customer intent and map them to the most relevant products and searches on site.
Work cross-functionally with different roles and your team, such as product management, core areas of the business to understand the problems we need to solve, and solution against them in a globally distributed environment.
What You'll Do:

Collaborate cross-functionally with product managers, UX designers, and backend engineers to understand business problems and translate them into responsive and performant front-end solutions.
Build scalable, maintainable, and highly interactive user interfaces using ReactJS, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
Work with RESTful APIs and ensure seamless data integration with backend services.
Use version control tools like Git for collaborative development and efficient release cycles.
Create and optimize cross-browser and cross-platform compatible applications.
Participate in writing unit tests and maintaining test coverage using tools like Jest or React Testing Library.
Contribute to full-stack development as needed using Java (Spring Boot) and SQL, particularly for understanding and integrating front-end components with backend services.
Collaborate in Agile teams and contribute to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement practices.
Utilize CI/CD pipelines and tools such as Jenkins, Docker, or Kubernetes to ensure reliable delivery of front-end applications.
Document technical solutions and maintain up-to-date knowledge of front-end best practices.

What You'll Need:

24 years of professional experience in front-end development using ReactJS and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
Strong understanding of HTML, CSS3, TypeScript, and responsive design principles.
Familiarity with backend technologies such as Java (Spring Boot) and experience writing or debugging SQL queries.
Experience integrating front-end components with REST APIs or GraphQL services.
Solid understanding of front-end state management patterns (e.g., Redux, Context API).
Basic understanding of containerised deployment environments such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.
Knowledge of modern development tools and build systems (Webpack, Babel, NPM/Yarn).
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work across teams.
Good documentation skills for writing and maintaining technical specifications and project artifacts.

Nice to Have:

Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools like Elasticsearch, Grafana, or Prometheus.
Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka or Redis.

The Global Merchandising organization is responsible for building and maintaining Wayfairs e-commerce catalog of over 24 million+ products. The organization consists of multiple teams who each play a crucial role in defining and executing on best-in-class merchandising. The Global Merchandising teams guide the management of our enormous product catalog and provide suppliers with tools to continually expand our product assortment. The Merch teams drive product discovery, consideration, and purchase on all of our stores and marketing channels by ensuring customers have complete, accurate, and relevant product information, and by removing friction for suppliers to provide it. The Data Integrations & Analytics teams leverage Big Data to optimize internal merchandising processes. Together, these teams deliver on key merchandising goals. 
Category Management
The Category Management team drives strategy for Wayfairs product categories through tight internal and external partnership. We serve as ambassadors of the product categories we manage. We are at the forefront as Wayfair redefines the supplier experience as a platform, giving suppliers more data, more transparency, and more control while retaining the high-touch elements that make working with Wayfair exceptional. Internally, we leverage a diverse set of cross-functional partners to execute our strategic vision. In a role on the Category Management team, you will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy within your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Members of the team must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective project managers.
Merchandising Compliance
Our Merchandising Compliance team is responsible for keeping our customers safe, and our products, services and offerings in compliance with applicable federal or local regulations. We support those efforts through building efficient processes and scalable technology solutions. If youre passionate about driving business impact by working cross functionally, love working through complex operations decisions, and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, then this is the perfect opportunity for you.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics 
The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, enabling teams to grow their businesses. As an associate you would help streamline processes, organize internal and external communication with regard to program updates, new tools, etc, and work closely with data to draw conclusions and influence stakeholders.
Perigold 
Perigold is Wayfairs newest brand, targeting the luxury home market. We are focused on providing an unparalleled assortment of luxury home goods through an elevated online shopping experience for our customers. We do this by connecting the best brands with our luxury customers while working on product curation, brand marketing and storytelling, building a best-in-class site experience, and providing best-in-class service and delivery. We serve as ambassadors for the categories we manage by identifying and solving unique customer and supplier challenges. Internally, we partner with various teams including Profit Management, Merchandising, Partner Operations, Marketing, Brand and Curated Merchandising and Promotions to bring the Perigold vision to life.
Scalable Purchasing, B2B Customer Enablement Team
Wayfairs B2B and Global Sales teams support Wayfair Professional and high-value Sales customers. The Customer Enablement (CE) team designs and implements customer-centric experiences that add value for our B2B and Sales customers. We serve customers via a gated site experience that is tailored based on a given customers vertical (e.g., Commercial Office, Interior Design, Contractor). The Scalable Purchasing team within Customer Enablement is focused on enabling transactional shopping behavior at scale: meeting business customers wherever they are. Focused on both digital transformation and change enablements required to meet customers needs. We seek a motivated associate with a leadership mindset who will partner with vertical leaders and customer enablement team members to optimize the customer journey to consistently exceed revenue targets and improve the customer experience. This role will help to implement transformative projects to enable scalable purchasing at large. Some examples of this include: enabling E-procurement &amp; Financing unlocks for B2B customers. The role will report to the Scalable Purchasing Lead and partner directly with cross-functional teams (B2B CM, Sales Tech, Revenue Operations, B2B Finance Operations, Fintech &amp; Sales Teams) to drive overall customer journey improvements. This includes proactively partnering with analytics to monitor performance and improve how we identify / prioritize customers, designing and implementing step-change improvements to the customer journey, and driving cross-functional projects that optimize the site-, sales-, or marketing treatment.
Supplier Advertising & Merch Services
The Supplier Advertising team sells and advocates the use of our advertising suite of products to our supplier base. We help suppliers stand out on site and amplify their exposure off site. The team is focused on driving: the maximum performance for every dollar a supplier spends with us and significant high margin revenue to Wayfairs bottom line.
Supplier Inventory Management
On the Supplier Inventory Management team, we partner with thousands of suppliers to maximize customers experience. This means driving speed and availability through supplier inventory and positioning strategies, leveraging both Wayfairs fulfillment services (CastleGate) as well as suppliers existing supply chains. On this team, you'll have a "COO" mindset, and be responsible for individual supplier and category inventory strategy, including integrating with Wayfair's e-comm and physical retail.

Title: Senior Specialist, Retail Back of House Operations
RoleDescription:
Sr. Specialist, Inventory & LogisticsLocation: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091Compensation: The entry pay rate for this role is $22/hr.
Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a crucial role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Using data-driven insights and strong problem-solving skills, youll implement best practices to improve product availability, reduce discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that elevate store performance. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment, has a strong background in inventory management and logistics, and is passionate about building scalable solutions that drive retail success.
 
What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

 Demonstrate Reliability & Professionalism: Maintain strong attendance and clear communication to meet business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
 Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control efforts to keep stock levels accurate, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies.
 Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and improve logistics workflows to increase efficiency, lower costs, and speed up fulfillment. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and supply chain coordination.
 Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments with accuracy. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment issues and improve delivery timelines.
 Drive Operational Excellence & Compliance: Monitor compliance with inventory and logistics policies, conduct regular audits, and apply corrective actions to uphold high operational standards.
 Mentor & Develop Logistics Team Members: Train and support Logistics & Inventory Specialists by sharing best practices, troubleshooting challenges, and promoting a high-performance culture.
 Analyze Performance & Drive Data-Driven Decisions: Track KPIs related to inventory, shipping, and logistics. Use insights to identify improvement areas and recommend effective solutions.
 Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics with broader business goals. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer satisfaction.
 Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to boost workflow, accuracy, and efficiency.
 Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Stay agile in a fast-paced environment, managing shifting priorities and proactively addressing challenges.

Youll Thrive in This Role if You Have:

 Education: Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field preferred, or equivalent work experience.
 Experience: 3 to 5 years in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, ideally in retail. Proven experience leading projects, mentoring teams, and improving operations.
 Inventory & Logistics Expertise: Deep knowledge of inventory management, logistics workflows, and stock accuracy best practices. Familiarity with Warehouse Management Systems and inventory tracking tech is a plus.
 Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Strong ability to analyze data, spot trends, and develop practical solutions for efficiency, accuracy, and cost control.
 Leadership & Collaboration: Experience mentoring and developing team members while partnering across store leadership, merchandising, and operations.
 Technical Proficiency: Skilled with Microsoft Office (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Experience with inventory management, order management, and scan technology preferred.
 Physical Requirements: Ability to stand, kneel, crouch, and perform repetitive motions frequently. Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 pounds.
 Availability: Open availability including nights, weekends, and holidays is required.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity:Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.
